node.title: New Caledonians will decide today whether they want to stay with France. Here's why Australians should care
node.description: New Caledonians will have their say on whether they want independence from France with the third and final referendum today — only this time, pro-independence supporters aren't planning to show up.

node.title: The drug lords who rule Asia's infamous Golden Triangle and the officers hot on their trail
node.description: Deep in the jungle where Myanmar, Laos and Thailand's borders meet lies the Golden Triangle, a trafficking heartland where drug runners and police play a dangerous — and sometimes deadly — game of cat and mouse.

node.title: It's back to the future, again: Close your eyes and you'd think this was the 1980s
node.description: Russian troops on the Ukraine border, an Olympics boycott, a "missing" tennis star: What century is this? Close your eyes and it is the 1980s again, writes Stan Grant.

node.title: Up to 100 killed in Kentucky as tornadoes wreak havoc in US
node.description: Up to 100 people have been killed in a devastating series of tornadoes that ripped through Kentucky and several other US states, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear says.

node.title: RNZ's Top 20 Albums of 2021
node.description: From Aotearoa psychedelic soul to electro cool indie pop, here are the Top 20 Albums of 2021 as voted by the RNZ Music whānau. Video, Audio

node.title: In Bakersfield, Many Find a California They Can Afford
node.description: Known for both oil and agriculture, the “Texas of California” rises in population as city dwellers seek backyards and shorter commutes.

node.title: Tornado Survivor Recounts Ordeal Below Rubble: 'I Did Not Think I Was Going to Make It'
node.description: Kyanna Parsons-Perez survived after a candle factory in Kentucky collapsed when a tornado hit Friday, killing dozens of people.

node.title: 'There's a lot of joy in being single': What Kerri and others have learnt about going solo
node.description: There's a perception that if you're not coupled up that you're somehow lesser, and that's something more people should question, says author Kerri Sackville.

node.title: How and when to see the best meteor shower of the year over Australia
node.description: Set your clocks and get ready for the Geminids, the best meteor shower in the Southern Hemisphere this year.

node.title: In Australian labs, scientists are racing to understand Omicron, the 'most evasive' variant yet
node.description: When Sydney's Kirby Institute pitted an Omicron sample against the antibodies of two vaccine doses, they couldn't block it — but there's still much to learn about the newest COVID-19 variant.

node.title: Body found in search for missing Kapiti Coast man
node.description: A body has been found in the search for Kapiti Coast man Joe Pryor.

node.title: Rev. C. Herbert Oliver, Civil Rights Activist, Dies at 96
node.description: He helped focus the nation on bombings and police abuse in Alabama in the 1960s and, later, on problems with the education of Black students in Brooklyn.

node.title: Kentucky governor says tornado was on ground for over 200 miles
node.description: "This will be, I believe, the deadliest tornado system to ever run through Kentucky," said Governor Andy Beshear.

node.title: Road Rage Incident Sees 12-Year-Old Girl Shot After Mom Parks at Convenience Store
node.description: The mother of the girl was allegedly involved in a road rage dispute with another driver in a red Dodge Charger.

node.title: Travis Scott Loses Cacti Beverage Brand as Astroworld Taints 'Marketing Genius' Reputation
node.description: "After careful evaluation, we have decided to stop all production and brand development of CACTI Agave Spiked Seltzer," AB InBev said.

node.title: All the Ways the Tornadoes That Struck Six States Were Unusual
node.description: "To have an outbreak of this magnitude, with this many tornado reports—it's a little unusual for this time of year," said meteorologist Dan Pydynowski.

node.title: Victoria records 1193 Covid-19 cases, 13 deaths
node.description: Victoria has recorded 1193 new local Covid-19 cases and 13 deaths, as authorities confirm another two new cases of the Omicron variant in Melbourne from returned international travellers.

node.title: Ex-QAnon Believer Warns Movement 'Getting Stronger,' Compares It to 'Doomsday Cult'
node.description: "I think it's inevitable that more real-world violence will occur in future," the former believer in the conspiracy theory cautioned.

node.title: Covid-19: Checkpoint stickers for Northland border snapped up
node.description: Traffic backed up for two kilometres in the Northland township of Waipu today, as people queued for stickers that will let them get through checkpoints with greater ease.

node.title: Kentucky university clarifies report on storm-related fatality
node.description: The university president said earlier that​ a student died in storms on his graduation day.

node.title: Some Voters Are at Odds With Their Party on Abortion
node.description: Despite decades of partisan fighting in Washington, Americans are not as neatly divided on abortion as politicians and activists.

node.title: Less Mange, More Frills: Rome’s New Mayor Bets on His Christmas Tree
node.description: The annual Christmas tree in the Italian capital has come under scrutiny ever since a 2017 debacle. Will this year’s pass social media muster?

node.title: One year after FDA authorized Pfizer's COVID vaccine, cases are on the rise
node.description: Saturday marks one year since the Food and Drug Administration authorized Pfizer's COVID-19​ vaccine.

node.title: Remembering Fred Hiatt
node.description: An editor know for his dogged reporting, defense of free speech and human rights, and superb editorial leadership.

node.title: Why Do We Ignore How the Other Half Lives?
node.description: Confined to our own bubbles, we are less informed about people who lead entirely different cultural, social and political lives.

node.title: ‘Our church is totally gone’: Tornado changes the landscape of a Kentucky town.
node.description: The people of Mayfield, a town of 10,000, surveyed the extensive tornado damage. Despite the devastation, one resident said, ‘We’ll be OK.’

node.title: Revoke the Omicron Travel Ban Against African Countries
node.description: And don’t make the same mistake again.

node.title: We Can Live Better Lives While Being Smart About Covid
node.description: This virus is not going to disappear anytime soon.

node.title: Echoes of Trump at a Rally for France’s Far-Right Upstart
node.description: Éric Zemmour, the polarizing far-right polemicist, launched his presidential campaign last week with a frenzied rally that was disrupted by a violent brawl.

node.title: Video Shows Bear Cub's Epic Battle With Inflatable Reindeer in Front Yard
node.description: "I looked up and there it was jumping on the reindeer. I was laughing to myself out in the street," a witness of the incident said.
